cs.man.ac.uk.log

Class LogWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.man.ac.uk.log.LogWriter

  • public class LogWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to write out log files.
    Version:
    1.0, 05/01/13
    Author:
    Rob Lyon

      • consoleOut

        public static void consoleOut(java.lang.String text,
                              boolean log)
        Writes unformatted text information to the terminal (console).
        Parameters:
        text - the text information to log.
        log - the verbose logging flag.

      • consoleOutFormatted

        Writes unformatted text information to the terminal (console).
        Parameters:
        text - the text information to log.
        log - the verbose logging flag.

      • logFormatted

        public static boolean logFormatted(java.lang.String path,
                                   java.lang.String text,
                                   boolean log)
        Writes formatted text information to the log file.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to write the log file to.
        text - the text information to log.
        log - the verbose logging flag.
        Returns:
        true if the logging operation was successful, else false.

      • logUnformatted

        public static boolean logUnformatted(java.lang.String path,
                                     java.lang.String text,
                                     boolean log)
        Writes unformatted text information to the log file.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to write the log file to.
        text - the text information to log.
        log - the verbose logging flag.
        Returns:
        true if the logging operation was successful, else false.

      • errorLogFormatted

        public static boolean errorLogFormatted(java.lang.String path,
                                        java.lang.String text,
                                        java.lang.Object e)
        Writes formatted error information to the log file.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to write the log file to.
        text - the text information that describes the circumstances under which the error occurred.
        e - the exception that occurred.
        Returns:
        true if the logging operation was successful, else false.

      • errorLogUnformatted

        public static boolean errorLogUnformatted(java.lang.String path,

                                          java.lang.Object e)
        Writes unformatted error information to the log file.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to write the log file to.
        text - the text information that describes the circumstances under which the error occurred.
        e - the exception that occurred.
        Returns:
        true if the logging operation was successful, else false.
